dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, you know, we always hear about these huge philanthropic pledges, right? Like, people promising billions to nonprofits. But who actually, uh, opens their wallets?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, you know, we always hear about these huge philanthropic pledges, right? Like, people promising billions to nonprofits. But who actually, uh, opens their wallets?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly! It's super easy to make a big splash with a promise. But Forbes, actually, with SHOOK Research, they looked into that â€“ like, who really followed through.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly! It's super easy to make a big splash with a promise. But Forbes, actually, with S H O O K Research, they looked into that - like, who really followed through.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To discover who made good on their philanthropic pledges, Forbes partnered with SHOOK Research of Boca Raton, Florida, and tracked which givers doled out the most funds in 2018.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And their methodology was pretty strict, which I appreciate. They only counted money that, um, reached the actual beneficiaries. So, no commitments that are still pending.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And their methodology was pretty strict, which I appreciate. They only counted money that, um, reached the actual beneficiaries. So, no commitments that are still pending.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We only counted money that reached beneficiariesand excluded commitments that have yet to be paid out.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] No, exactly. No future promises. It's about what's *actually* been paid out. Not even money sitting in a foundation's bank account, unspent.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, exactly. No future promises. It's about what's actually been paid out. Not even money sitting in a foundation's bank account, unspent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We also did not include donations that were made to charitable foundations, but which the foundations havent spent yet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. And, uh, surprise, surprise, Warren Buffett is still topping the list for the fifth year running.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. And, uh, surprise, surprise, Warren Buffett is still topping the list for the fifth year running.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For the fifth year running, Berkshire Hathaway chairman Warren Buffett tops the list at No.1

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, for sure. And then you've got Bill and Melinda Gates, Michael Bloomberg, the Walton family, George Soros, all rounding out that top five. And, like, most of these folks are also the wealthiest Americans.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, for sure. And then you've got Bill and Melinda Gates, Michael Bloomberg, the Walton family, George Soros, all rounding out that top five. And, like, most of these folks are also the wealthiest Americans.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bill and Melinda Gates, Michael Bloomberg, the Walton family and George Soros round out the top five. Most of the top philanthropists are also among the richest Americans in the country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Nine out of the top ten givers are on the Forbes 400 list, and 39 of the top 50, which is just, uh, incredible.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Nine out of the top ten givers are on the Forbes four hundred list, and thirty nine of the top fifty, which is just, uh, incredible.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Nine of the top ten givers made it to the ranks of the 2019 Forbes 400 list; altogether, 39 of the 50 top givers are Forbes 400 members.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. And the numbers are huge. In 2018 alone, America's 50 most generous philanthropists, like, doled out $14.1 billion. That's up from $12.6 billion in 2017.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. And the numbers are huge. In twenty eighteen alone, America's fifty most generous philanthropists, like, doled out fourteen point one billion dollars. That's up from twelve point six billion dollars in twenty seventeen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In total, America's 50 most generous philanthropists gave out $14.1 billion in 2018, up from $12.6 billion in 2017

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's a significant jump. And then, collectively, their *lifetime* giving, which is just wild to think about, exceeds $173 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's a significant jump. And then, collectively, their lifetime giving, which is just wild to think about, exceeds one hundred seventy three billion dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Collectively, the group's lifetime givinga tally of funds distributed by their foundations plus direct giftsexceeds $173 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Just mind-boggling, isn't it? Like, that's real impact.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Just mind-boggling, isn't it? Like, that's real impact.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh. But they do mention that this list, you know, might be missing some big givers because they rely on the philanthropists themselves or their representatives for the data. Some just choose not to participate.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh. But they do mention that this list, you know, might be missing some big givers because they rely on the philanthropists themselves or their representatives for the data. Some just choose not to participate.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Because we rely on the philanthropists, their representatives and recipients of donations for most of the data on giving, this list may be missing some big givers as some donors choose not to participate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which makes sense, I guess. But even with that, the scale of what these individuals are actually contributing, it's just, like, incredibly impressive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which makes sense, I guess. But even with that, the scale of what these individuals are actually contributing, it's just, like, incredibly impressive.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it really puts the "action" in philanthropy, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it really puts the action in philanthropy, doesn't it?
